data.title: Carlos Marshall, Jr. - 2023-24 - Men's Basketball
data.meta_description:
Carlos Marshall, Jr. (22) G  - All-WCC Honorable Mention (2023-24)
WCC All-Academic (2023-24)
WCC Men's Basketball Player of the Week (Nov. 12, 2023)
Tied for
data.text:
All-WCC Honorable Mention (2023-24)

WCC All-Academic (2023-24)

WCC Men's Basketball Player of the Week (Nov. 12, 2023)

Tied for most single game 3-pointers in program history (9 at SJSU, 12/20/23)

AT SANTA CLARA: Played in 34 total games with 26 starts in two seasons with the Broncos ... Averaged 12.9 points, 4.2 rebounds and 1.6 assists per game ... Shot 48.2 percent from the floor and 42.4 percent from 3-point range ... 24 career double figure scoring games ... Career-high was 29 points at San Jose State (12/20); tied school record of nine 3-pointers.

2023-24: Returned from injury for one final season as a graduate player ... Earned All-WCC honors as an honorable mention pick ... Played in 31-of-33 games with 26 starts ... Finished second on the team in scoring (14th in WCC) with 13.2 points on 48.2 percent shooting ... Led team in 3-point shooting with 61 made treys on 42.4 percent ... 11th in WCC with 2.0 treys per game ... Averaged 4.4 rebounds and 24.2 minutes ... Averaged 11.3 points in league play ... Became the first Bronco since John Bryant in 2006-07 to open a season with three 20-point games ... Began the season with 22 points against Utah Tech (11/8) and followed with 25 against Saint Francis (11/11) and 20 at Stanford (11/14) ... Named WCC Player of the Week for the first week of the season (11/12) ... Finished the year with six 20-point games and team-high 22 double figure scoring efforts ... Tied the program record with nine made 3s as part of a career-high 29 points at San Jose State (12/20); also dished out a career-high six assists ... Was 11-of-20 and 4-of-6 from 3-point range for 26 points in final game against Saint Mary's in the WCC Tournament Semifinal (3/11) ... Scored 23 points at Saint Mary's (1/31) ... Posted his first double-double as a Bronco (and second of career) with 14 points and 12 rebounds vs. Mississippi Valley State (11/20) ... Was 5-of-6 from the field, 3-for-4 from 3-point range and 6-of-6 FT for 19 points in win over Duquesne (12/23) ... 19 points on 7-of-9 shooting against Pepperdine (1/25) ... Season-high four steals against Stanford (11/14) ... Had 16 points and eight rebounds in final home game against San Francisco (3/2) ... Named to the WCC All-Academic team.

2022-23: Played in the Broncos' first three games of the season where he averaged 10.0 ppg before suffering a season-ending injury ... Scored 12 points on 5-of-7 shooting in his SCU debut vs. Eastern Washington (11/7) ... Followed up with eight points vs. Georgia Southern (11/10) and 10 points on the road against Utah State (11/14).

TENNESSEE STATE: Was a two-time All-Ohio Valley Conference (OVC) selection ... In 2021-22, he earned all-conference honors as a redshirt junior after averaging 12.8 points, 3.4 rebounds and 1.4 assists per game ... His 12.8 ppg led the team and ranked 11th in the OVC ... Was the OVC's second-best 3-point shooter at 40.6 percent and ranked sixth in the league with 1.9 treys per contest ... Had 18 double-digit scoring efforts, including five 20-point outings in 2021-22 ... Dropped a then-career-high 26 points against Campbellsville-Harrodsburg ... Had a pair of 25-point games, including one against UT Martin in which he was 7-of-9 from 3-point range ... Did not see any action in 2020-21 ... Joined the Tigers in 2019-20 and quickly made his mark on the program by earning spots on the All-OVC Second and All-Newcomer Teams ... Started 27 of 31 games that season while leading the team with 11.7 ppg and tallying 19 double-digit scoring games.

CAREER:

Finished his NCAA D1 career with 1,201 points ... 96 appearances and 76 starts ... Averaged 12.5 points, 4.2 rebounds and 1.7 assists ... Career 44.4 percent shooter and 42.4 percent from 3-point range.

JUNIOR COLLEGE: Played one season at Southwest Tennessee Community College ... Earned first team All-Tennessee Community College Athletics Association Region Seven honors ... Was the team's second-leading scorer at 12.8 ppg ... Had a career-high 30 points on 10-of-14 3-point shooting against Blue Mountain College.

HIGH SCHOOL: Attended Southwind High in Memphis where he led the team to a 32-7 record and a spot in the Class AAA state championship game as a senior in 2017 ... Earned a spot on the AAA All-Metro team as a senior and was an all-state pick as a junior.
